table.name: sql_execution
table.description: Intermediate table holding summary of customer SQL performance for lookup and analysis.

columns.name: SQL_EXECUTION_SEQ
columns.description: Unique ID for the SQL ID and Type.

columns.name: SQL_ID
columns.description: The SQL ID for the monitored statement.

columns.name: TYPE
columns.description: The source of any explain plan or performance information: APRIORI - theoretical explain plans; CURSOR - the cursor cache; AWR - the automatic workload repository.

columns.name: USE_CASE
columns.description: The use case for the statement within its category. (E.g. SAVED_QUERY_GID for saved queries).

columns.name: SQL_FULL
columns.description: Full SQL of the monitored statement.

columns.name: TOTAL_ELAPSED_TIME
columns.description: Elapsed time for the statement to run. For cursor cache queries, this is the cumulative time since the cursor was placed in cache; for AWR it's the cumulative elapsed time during the snapshots.

columns.name: TOTAL_ROWS_PROCESSED
columns.description: The total number of rows processed by the statement. For cursor cache queries, this is the rows processed since the cursor was placed in the cache; for AWR, the rows processed during the snapshots.

columns.name: TOTAL_EXECUTIONS
columns.description: The total number of exceptions of the statement. For cursor cache queries, this is the executions since the cursor was placed in the cache; For AWR, the executions during the snapshots.

columns.name: AVG_ELAPSED_TIME
columns.description: Average elapsed time per statement execution. For cursor cache statements, this is the average since the cursor was placed in cache; for AWR it's the average during the snapshots.

columns.name: AVG_ROWS_PROCESSED
columns.description: Average rows processed per statement execution for the statement to run. For cursor cache statements, this is the average since the cursor was placed in cache; for AWR it's the average during the snapshots.

columns.name: LAST_EXECUTION_TIME
columns.description: For cursor cache queries, the last execution time for the statement. For AWR queries, this is left null.

columns.name: HAS_PLAN
columns.description: If Y, the SQL execution has a corresponding explain plan available.
